column5: Its that time of year we will be beginning to start the lifts on the Credit in the next week or so...time to roll up the sleeves and put something back....  Great opportunity to see  lots of steelhead, help with a major conservation project  the craa message board will give the specifics www.craa.on.ca _________________

Lifts will be every night at 5 pm. However we will not lift in heavy rain and cold weather (below 7 C). The reason is fish will not come into the fish ladder. They will only come in when the water temp exceeds 6C in big numbers. Today we only had 3.5-4 C so only 6 fish. Sunny warm days are prime. If we have a warm, sunny day (as forecast for most of next week) we could be lifting over 100 fish a night. Or breaking last years record of 370 fish in one night. Then we will need tons of help!!!!   We will be lifting steelhead Saturday and Sunday
Dang too bad it wasn't earlier I would have made it for sure... I will try to get there Sunday but they go till the end of may correct?
we go until all fish have been lifted....generally 3 weeks at the most
hello i am new to fishing. Can any1 tell me what fish lift is.does it mean they release fish so we can catch or it is something else.let me know thx
They assist the fish in gettin over the dams into prime spawning territory
can u practice catch & release there.let me know.thx.
Good luck with a successful lift Louis..  ... and New Angler go    somewhere else !
Irishfield,  Why are you trolling with the eye of your rod?  Are you hoping to catch some round eye goby's?
LOL! Why do you assume that every newbie is a troll?
I don't jonnybass.. just be glad your 30 day probabation period is up tomorrow!
thanks Wayne  If your so inclined and have a trip planned come by and take a peek great site to see for sure
